page.title: 01The Upper Ewes Valley
page.content: Ewes Water, a tributary of the River Esk, flows through a typical Border landscape. The main Carlisle - Edinburgh road parallels the river here. There are 2 large hill farms - one privately owned, and one run by a trust - several smallholdings & private houses. The valleys of the Mosspeeble Burn & its tributary streams, along with a strip of land in the east of this section, form part of a Site of Special Scientific Interest, considered by the nationally important as an example of Border Uplands. It has a great variety of alpint flora and native trees. Arkleton is an extensive hill sheep & cattle farm. The trust which runs it studies new approaches to rural development, with emphasis on education & training. Arkleton House is used as a Seminar Centre.
